field.p: Provide transparency on how water- and marine-related data are measured, consolidated, and verified across the undertaking.

field.p: Data are obtained through direct flow measurements, smart meters, or supplier-provided utility records. In areas where direct monitoring is not available, estimates are based on production volumes, water intensity factors, or modeled consumption data.

Effluent quality is tracked through laboratory testing and local water authority reports. Marine-related data (e.g., discharge, waste into marine areas) are monitored in line with national regulations and international frameworks (e.g., EU Water Framework Directive, Marine Strategy Framework Directive).
Water and marine data cover all operational sites within the organizational boundary, including production facilities, offices, and logistics hubs.

Upstream and downstream activities (e.g., supplier withdrawals, product use) are included when material or when data are available. Sites in high-water-stress areas are prioritized for detailed reporting.
Data are verified internally by the environmental management team and, where applicable, externally assured under ISO 14046 (Water Footprint) or ISO 14001.
Includes 3-5 years of water consumption, discharge, and recycling trends, showing efficiency gains or impacts from climate variability and operational changes.
